title: Regression: Inlined loops not fully evaluating with `const`-eable dependencies

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
pub fn arr() -> usize {
  let values = [23, 16, 54, 3, 60, 9];
  let mut acc = 0;
  for item in values { 
    acc += item;
  }
  acc
}
```

I expected to see this happen: The loop should be inlined because `values` is const-known. For example, here is the generated assembly on Rust 1.63.0 ([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/75Y1c63cE)) and Rust Beta ([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/KhcozT55j)):

```asm
example::arr:
        mov     eax, 165
        ret
```

Instead, this happened: On nightly, the loop is inlined. However, the entire function is not computed despite the stable and beta Rust inlining it.  Here is the generated assembly on Nightly ([Godbolt](https://godbolt.org/z/7bTWPh15s)):

```asm
.LCPI0_0:
        .quad   23
        .quad   16
.LCPI0_1:
        .quad   54
        .quad   3
.LCPI0_2:
        .quad   60
        .quad   9
example::arr:
        sub     rsp, 72
        movaps  xmm0, xmmword ptr [rip + .LCPI0_0]
        movaps  xmmword ptr [rsp], xmm0
        movaps  xmm0, xmmword ptr [rip + .LCPI0_1]
        movaps  xmmword ptr [rsp + 16], xmm0
        movaps  xmm0, xmmword ptr [rip + .LCPI0_2]
        movaps  xmmword ptr [rsp + 32], xmm0
        mov     qword ptr [rsp + 56], 6
        xor     ecx, ecx
        xor     edx, edx
        jmp     .LBB0_1
.LBB0_3:
        lea     rdi, [rcx + 1]
        mov     qword ptr [rsp + 48], rdi
        mov     rdx, qword ptr [rsp + 8*rcx]
        mov     esi, 1
        mov     rcx, rdi
        add     rdx, rax
        test    rsi, rsi
        je      .LBB0_5
.LBB0_1:
        mov     rax, rdx
        cmp     rcx, 5
        jbe     .LBB0_3
        xor     esi, esi
        add     rdx, rax
        test    rsi, rsi
        jne     .LBB0_1
.LBB0_5:
        add     rsp, 72
        ret
```

### Meta

n/a - disclosed at usages

Keywords: const inline loop, const loop, const loop not evaluated

Relevant discord thread: https://discord.com/channels/273534239310479360/592856094527848449/1013050670942793808
